review_text: Nice trail and view of the river. I was expecting a longer hike though

Beautiful trail approximately three miles. Great for running, biking, walking, roller skating, etc.

There are some nice parks along the trail to stop at in addition to villages just off the trail providing restaurants, stores, etc.

I absolutely love this place. I walked my dog here on the regular. It's always very clean, and DCR does a wonderful job of keeping it that way.I appreciate everyone that pitches in to preserve this place.  I do wonder if it's worth casting A-line under that river and seeing what I couldn't pull out. I'm not too sure though if it's fish that migrate up through there or not. There's been a boat underneath the 93 bridge for a while now. I'll add a photo of that.  There is also a water feature in the center of the park for children to play on hot days. There are also several water fountains available and they are actually well designed with 3 separate tiers, one for Adults, one for children, and a lower one for dogs!  How smart.

Once again this is another place to put on your bucket list. They have so much to offer you hiking, picnic areas for the family and more. It is peaceful and relaxing while enjoying your time with nature. You were see birds and more. Take your family for a day of fun. Or maybe just need a little time to relax?

This is a great resource.
We are looking forward to the cleanup later this month.
It appears that as the park and walk gets dirtier with trash, people stop picking up after their pets.
Very nice bike trail. We really enjoyed biking in this beautiful trail
Great walk. Beautiful day. Lots of others enjoying the day safely.
This place is beautiful. All the wildlife was great to see. There were ducks, geese and a swan family.

place_name: Neponset River Estuary Area of Critical Environmental Concern
review_text: Great place to fly a kite

place_name: Neponset River Estuary Area of Critical Environmental Concern
review_text: Lots of trails and great place to take dogs for a walk (on leash).

place_name: Neponset River Estuary Area of Critical Environmental Concern
review_text: Had super cool days here. And some days were fine.

place_name: Neponset River Estuary Area of Critical Environmental Concern
review_text: Bring a bike, roller blades, wheelchair accessible and dog friendly. Great view

place_name: Neponset River Estuary Area of Critical Environmental Concern
Neponset River Estuary Area of Critical Environmental Concern
Neponset River Estuary Area of Critical Environmental Concern

review_text: I would have given the bike path here 5 stars but for one issue. People need to be aware of the fact that the pathway is being used by Walkers, bicyclists, carriages, skaters etc with traffic going in both directions so...stay to the right of the path and reduce potential collisions.

It's a nice and place to lounge around. I like to sit on a particular bench & just chill there for HOURS. There is a NEW pathway they built that goes thru Milton & Mattapan. So if ur in2 jogging, biking, & walkingthen you came to the right place
Get out the house enjoy the weather go somewhere different for a change
Liked the walk along the river. Wish people would keep their dogs leashed though.
Beautiful space to move. Clearly come a long way from its dirty industrial past!
DURING THE WEEK YOU CAN WALK AROUND THE PONDS, AND LITERALLY NEVER SEE ANYONE ELSE THERE......BUT IT GETS BUSY ON THE WEEKEND HARD TO FIND PARKING ON WEEKENDS
Right by my house great for walking the dog, running, walking and biking!
Lovely place to relax with your family and friends.

We always go here for quick 15-mile rides.
I wouldn't hesitate to think it's our most favorite one despite it's somewhat short. We looped many places a few times to reach this distance.
It's exclusively for pedestrians and bicyclists. It's clean and safe. There are only 2 crossings, and they're pretty safe.
Great view. My kid loves walking here during the day.

The trail is historic and very calming with the river running next to it. As I walk along I can feel at peace with self and stress was immediately lifted when I near the water. It's also known to go biking along the factory down by the trolley. I can recommend this to anyone up for a scenic walk or bike ride.

This is one of the best bike trails in Boston area, I have been biking around MA, this is one of my favorites, the other two are both in Cape Cod, Shining Sea Bikeway and Cape Cod Rail Trail. If you don't want to drive for one and a half hours to Cape Cod, this one is perfect for you.
I've lived in Boston since 96 and walk here for the 1st time last week Amazingly, calm quiet beautiful!
This is a fantastic bike path! If you never have, you need to.  Fantastic scenery, along the water. superb.

such an easy place to bring your kids on a nice hot or warm day. there's a pool, playground and trail with so many different routes so bring good shoes and a bike or scooter. i wish the pool hours were more specific because it came absolutely be confusing. i love the set up. it's not too big or too small and it's like a upgraded splash pad. it's really cool. there's also a basketball court across from the playground which is super cool.

Short trail but very scenic with several terrain changes.  There are two major street crossings but one has a light so it's very safe. Mostly flat but there is a slight elevation going over the bridge over the tracks just before Mattapan square.

I love the Neponset River Trail! My husband and I like to run along here and it connects to the Pope John Paul II park. You can make it a decent ~8 mile loop if you connect the parks and do full neponset rail trail. It's clean but can sometimes be crowded.
Literally died. Me and my grandpa came here, and he slipped on one of the WET logs. As the start of the review suggests he did, in fact, die. Other than that it was a great experience, 4 stars
some great logs to cross it, would run from angsty fourteen year olds again
Site of mob and gangster burials
Poor information or map distribution
New playground (remodeling from a small playground) walking and biking trail. Big soccer yard and other activities. Great for family time.

place_name: Pope John Paul II Park, Boston
review_text:
There are different things for everyone: walking, biking, fishing, jogging, etc..
There are soccer fields, too.
At the entrenched near the parking lot, there're 2 portable toilets, just in case.

place_name: Pope John Paul II Park, Boston
review_text: Lots of open green space next to the Neponset river. Lovely mix of programmed spaces: sports fields, tot lot and natural fields. Loads of feral bunnies and native bird species. Well maintained paved paths for walking and other activities. DCR owned and maintained, used by many different communities for many different uses: hiking, athletics, fishing, picnicking, and just being out in nature.

place_name: Pope John Paul II Park, Boston
review_text:
I frequent here once a week or every other week. It's a great place to walk dogs, jog, play soccer, and even has a kids playground. The views are nice. Plenty of dogs on and off leash. People tend to be flexible and open minded about dogs off leash, though please keep yours on a leash if they're aggressive or untrained. People are also good about picking up after their dogs. Long story short...please don't ruin it for the rest of us.

The only reason for 4 stars is that it's right next to 93. So you'll have that road noise no matter what. Not exactly the type of serene sound to match the visuals.

place_name: Pope John Paul II Park, Boston
review_text:
YES, You can fly drone at this park.

It has the great view and the atmosphere was calm and peaceful.

There are 2 parking lots/ 2 entrances, go there and explore it your self ^^

There are some berry tree along the sidewalk. Remember to respect the birds living there. Spear the love <3

place_name: Pope John Paul II Park, Boston
review_text:
Well maintained landscape,  beautiful open space to hang out as a family,  picnic,  walking, biking, just quiet . Pretty much an outdoor oasis.
Right off the hwy,  if you need to stretch out your legs,  rest. There are plenty parking on site and Porta potty as well.

place_name: Pope John Paul II Park, Boston
review_text: Nice space for walking, running, biking, playing sports, and flying a kite. Plenty of room for everyone. Has playground and portable bathrooms. Sometimes the city has movie nights too

place_name: Pope John Paul II Park, Boston
review_text: Beautiful place. Great trails. I will definitely be back. The walkways are beautiful. The people seemed friendly. People picked the poop up. There was a huge soccer field that I definitely want to play on. It seems like a great place to get yourself together. My partner was happy to be here. There was a definite contrast between the Quincy side and Dorchester. I was very happy.

place_name: Pope John Paul II Park, Boston
review_text: It is nice that's the old drive in ground of neponset in Dorchester. I remember going to drive in as a child. The person who accompanied me yesterday to the soccer  practice said they had made it a landfill and when I think landfill I think mounds of garbage. Well if it was you couldn't tell. There was playground and the hugest soccer  field I've ever seen. It was a total of 6 teams and different age groups practicing and enough space for all to practice and there was a walking lane which we went to two separate locations of this park that was extensive stretch of this park location in Dorchester.  Next time they should say location next to Walgreens just before going under the bridge to quincy on right hand side. Glad I'd didn't catch public transportation or I'd never gone to seen  the person I went to see.

It's a beautiful field and 2 baseball fields with including a nice playground, parts of it include unique designs. It does include newer types of swings and regular swings plus slides and monkey bars. Including a bubbler for people and dogs on the bottom of it. It's been a popular playground for generations

Great playground near my house. It has slides for little kids and big kids. And has a lot of place for them to run. But parents has to watch their kids very carefully since it is right to a pretty busy road.
Nice park, very friendly, peaceful place to bring your kids. Plenty of parking markets around to shop. You can also have a picnic if you must.
Great park to bring the lil ones to run around would be better if the basketball court didnt have so many crack on it.
Great for small kids, very quiet
It's a wonderful place for all ages
Need to enforce police people keep bringing dogs over there and it says no dogs allowed
I wish people would actually put their dog waste in the trash barrel

Came here for an overnight trip with my son and his class. It's so peaceful here on Thompson Island, a nice break away from the city.  The staff are very nice and great with the kids. Definitely worth checking out if you have never been here.

I went there as a kid 13 years old.  I found it challenging but eye opening as a minority kid from mission Hill,  Roxbury.  I loved the learning, new environment they put us into,  the natural settings.  At the same time I was shocked by the biased treatment I received by the inner city minority kids I was with. Closed minds stay closed.
My favorite camp ever
Nice view when you are stuck in gridlock
A three star bridge.
A+ will drive over bridge again
Very nice
Had such a good time! Atmosphere was exciting, staff friendly, bowling so much fun. We did have a little glitch but Manager Tasheka was more than accommodating to make up. A definite recommendation!
response_from_owner_text:
Garrett, thanks for such a glowing review! Tasheka always knows how to solve a problem, glad she could solve yours. Hope to see you again soon!
-Colleen Fleming, Director of Marketing

review_text: Visited from Houston, Texas with 71 high schoolers. They had a blast!!! Great service and great atmosphere.
response_from_owner_text:
So glad your group had a great time, Cassandra! We hope to see you on your next trip to Boston, too! 
-Colleen Fleming, Director of Marketing

review_text: What a fantastic place...super fun time at Candlepin bowling! Group photo for score/frame background made this vacation excursion extra celebratory! Free socks were a surprise and so helpful since this was the first stop after the airport pickup! Can't wait to be back!
response_from_owner_text:
Sounds like a great time was had! Thanks for 5 stars, we hope to be your first stop next time you come to Boston! 
-Colleen Fleming, Director of Marketing

review_text: The kids have so much fun bowling and playing all the games in the arcade ... The food is good and the drinks are delicious...
response_from_owner_text:
Thanks for the 5 stars, Kimberly! Glad the kids had fun...and sounds like you did too! 
-Colleen Fleming, Director of Marketing

review_text:
It's a great place for everyone, families with children, couples, friends (both young and old). I use to take my children here when they were young. Now they are young men. The place has changed but still pretty nice. Food is good, drink are good, and all of it is pretty affordable given the location. In fact, I went from having son 5th birthday there to...by his choice....having his 23rd birthday there. Oh did I mention it is handicap accessible too?
...because it is.
response_from_owner_text: It's always special to hear from longtime customers, Nita, and I love hearing about your boys growing up at our place. We'd be happy to host the family any night. I appreciate your support online and off. - Jerome Miles - Marketing Director

review_text: Had such a nice time. I had my daughter's 8th birthday party there and was so the money worth. The staff went above and beyond even though they were short staffed and the place was a little crowded. I will 100 percent recommend.
response_from_owner_text:
We are so glad that you chose Boston Bowl for your daughter's birthday party! There's nothing better than a birthday on the lanes. Thanks for coming and we hope to see you soon!
-Colleen Fleming, Director of Marketing

review_text: It was my only stoppage place for me 20 years ago when they opened 24h. Still fun now
response_from_owner_text:
Thanks Danny for the 5 star review! And great pics! We hope to see you again very soon.
-Colleen Fleming, Director of Marketing

review_text: Had my daughter's bday party here and we had a great time. The person in charge of the events is useless( Aaron is his name ) . I had to go in person because he wouldn't respond to calls , Vm or emails. He's name is everywhere pertaining to evens but if I didn't walk in personally and had someone else help me nothing would've been done. He can't communicate and when it does is back and forth unresponsive emails.  The food was great, music and environment. As to parties the lack of organization and communication with customers can be better . Gave a 3 because I got a package for the birthday and it was all over of the place with the  game cards
response_from_owner_text:
Hi Mari! Thank you for the feedback regarding your experience. We are glad that in the end your daughter's birthday was wonderful. In the meantime we will be sure to address your review with our staff to see how we can improve!
-Colleen Fleming, Director of Marketing

review_text: Good if it's close by and nothing else is available. Definitely in need of some repairs. Simple. Clean. Kids love it bc there's water. But water does not come out of every spout on the splash pad.

Clean. Simple. Fun. Nice size parking lot. Good for varying ages. Kids can play "street soccer" or "street hockey" on one side of the playground while the other is made of swings, slides, rock wall and more. It's a family fun area. Most children who frequent this park range from 2-12 years old. Different times of the day attract different ages. Regardless, it's family friendly and close to different towns, which means exceeding a 2 hour window of fun at this park is NOT ideal for anyone who has a little one and does not live in the neighborhood because there are no bathrooms and with traffic-it may take more than 7 or 10 minutes to drive home, depending on where you live. An urgent potty drive is never fun for anyone ( toddlers or adults). So, be kind to yourself and plan accordingly.
P.s.
There is a field across the street where families enjoy the sprinklers and picnics.

It's a nice place it just need a little cleaning and where the sprinklers are at and needs to be patched up there's holes saw two kids fall by tripping over one of the holes otherwise it's a perfect place to relax with your kids when it's real hot

It's a really nice park that seems underutilized. Great play area with activities for different ages, with a wooded area and a pavement hockey ground next to it. Parking is across the street, facing the Neponset River.
There are play structures for big and little kids. It's clean. I didn't notice a bathroom but I believe there's one across the street on the other side of the park.
Good neighborhood, good people and nice little park for the kids, also a water sprinkler across the street for kids on those HOT days.. We always had a good time coming here..
Best place to go .Sullivan's best place to eat..
I really like this playground, especially the fact it has an adjacent splash area across the street which is also close to the water where you can watch boats come by.

Flooding in the trails during storms.
Great views of the beach, harbor and iconic gas tanks.
I enjoy going to State Parks.  This is a beautiful walking trail by the newly developed neighborhood in North Quincy

This is supposedly the best sunset point in Quincy. It's located in a nice and clean locality. Plenty of public parking space. It's not a huge walk but good for short evening stroll, especially if you have pets. Nice seating at the edge of the water. Small beach access as well.

Decent park for exploring. I think it could be much better if it was a bit more taken care of...Lots of dogs off leash so be careful if you have small kids or your own pup. Nice little walk that opens up to a landing. Once you hit the landing you have great views from Marina Bay. A nice little beach to relax and take in the views.
It's such a nice quiet place whether your just out for a walk or walking your dog it is nice!

This is a small park aside a housing complex.  It provides a panoramic view of the marina bay as it opens to the Atlantic ocean. It has a spacious peer with a servicing ferry. There are plenty of benches to sit down and take in the view.

Of all the parks within walking distance of my house, this one is my favorite. This is a great place to come to see the Boston skyline and to pet a friendly dog. Also it's a popular place for birding.
Live nearby and love it here! Great views of the harbor and Boston and very dog friendly. Watch out for coyotes at dusk!

Great doggy off the leash experience if you have a RD( real dog) I have a 17 lbs poodle.She was intimidated by big dogs rushing her and I was afraid they would knock me down. ( Happened 3xs ) would go again with friends that have big dogs to make a larger pack. No human bathrooms
Lots of space and trails  Great views
They have beautiful Mulberry trees that produce tasty fruit.

Joseph Finnegan Park is an underrated Boston gem! I'm a wedding photographer and one of my couples wanted to go here for their engagement session. It was perfect, with simple, nice aesthetics, paved trails and grass, and really nice views. Not only was it pleasant walking here, but it also felt safe.

Highly recommended for photography, walking, biking, or just hanging out!

Very small but cute park. There's some signs talking about the history of the park throughout. Perfect for dog walkers, families, people on bikes. There are benches but they don't all face the water. Definitely come if you're in the area or live here but it is small, so I personally wouldn't make a special trip to visit the park.
Great place for a walk, ride or run.

What another gem of an urban park in the city of Boston. A reclamation of a contaminated coastal brownfield into a beautiful and serene park. It's off the beaten path, but well worth the visit. You can get your calm back on here. Just smell that wonderful salty sea smell.
It's a very small brand new park. Not much to rate here. Glad to see it instead of a dump that used to be in its place though
Nice park with paved paths for walking along the neponset, also good for plane watching.
It's just a nice addition to the pope John Paul park and neponset trail.  I'm glad for the green space.

2cnd day. I like it. I'm there at 3am and there is no one to show me anything, but I'll figure it out.

3 20 24. 4 months going. The gentlemen who work the overnight shift are great. Constantly cleaning and great customer service. I go from 2am to 3am. Improve a lot and learned a lot. Other members are friendly and helpful. This has been a great experience.

5 6 24. Really enjoy this gym at 2am. The crew is awesome. Folks workingbout are kind.
Easy to use whatever equipment you want.

Love the fact that it's open 24hrs 4 days out of the week. Works great with my schedule. Place is clean and truly has so many machines and so many different sections where you can do your own thing. I have encountered really nice people there ( workers and other PF members) who take time out to help if need be.
response_from_owner_text:
Thank you for being a part of our amazing community, Taisha!  We always love hearing when our members help eachother out.
If you want to invite a friend to join in on the fun, you can share this link for a Free Day Pass: https://planetfitness.app.link/daypass! Additionally, if you haven't already, give our app a try to make check-ins even more convenient: https://planetfitness.app.link/download.

review_text: I really like this place because it has many machines. Also, almost every person there is just to work out and not shoot videos or get attention. However, you're a HEAVY LIFTER, then this isn't the place for you.  Another issue is that it can get crowded at certain times so schedul accordingly.
response_from_owner_text:
We appreciate your feedback, David! Just in case, don't forget that we have a crowd meter on our club pages that members can check before paying us a visit to see how busy the club is at any given time:
https://www.planetfitness.com/gyms/dorchester-ma

The crowd meter is available via our app as well, for convenient access right from your pocket!
https://planetfitness.app.link/download

review_text: People here hog strength machines. Camp out for 15 mins before moving on to something else. Very busy place most hours of the day. Lots of equipment which is nice. Very clean & upbeat atmosphere. Disappointing to have such a negative experience for a place that has so much potential.
response_from_owner_text: Thanks for taking a moment to share your experience and feedback with us, although we're disheartened to hear about this, friend! All members and guests are expected to follow proper gym etiquette, as well as adhere to the policies that are in place at our clubs. If you ever see others hogging machines and not actively working out, feel free to reach out to one of our friendly staff members. They would most certainly like to hear your feedback and take the appropriate actions moving forward. We enjoy being a part of your fitness journey and look forward to seeing you again soon!

review_text: Moved to this location so I could train with Lenny the instructor at this location. I highly recommend working with him. Gym space is  great! Highly recommend.
response_from_owner_text: We're glad to hear you moved to this location to train with Lenny and appreciate your high recommendation. Providing a great gym space and excellent instructors is our priority.

review_text:
I really had a bad experience at that gym dealing with a manager who is unprofessional and racist. After working out I was washing my face and I heard someone yelling behind me: ( what are you doing? I've just cleaned the sink). I responded: sir I'm on my way to work and I need to wash the sweat off my face. The unprofessional manager replied: well I've just dried the sink and the mirror and you've splashed water all over. I responded: Sorry sir but I had to wash my face.)
After this encounter I reported the incident to the regional manager in that area and he or she has never gotten back to me . Now here's the load that broke the Camel's back: upon checking in to the gym I realized after a few minutes that I forgot something in my car , upon coming back from my vehicle I was coerced to check in again . They advised me that I needed to check in each and every single time I go to my car.
response_from_owner_text: We never want our visitors or members to have a less than stellar experience at our Planet. We'd appreciate it if you could take the time to reach out to our team at social@planetfitness.com, so your concerns can be addressed accordingly. Thank you!

review_text: Why isn't there any heavier weight for dumbbells past 75lbs? Also, there should be at the very least one unassisted barbell bench press and squat rack also. Can anyone explain?
response_from_owner_text: Hey there, friend! Since our clubs are independently owned and operated, the variety of equipment will vary by club. However, we are always open to hearing recommendations from our members and guests on how we can further enhance their experiences at our Planet! Your home club's manager will be the best point of contact to address any suggestions you may have. Feel free to reach out to management at your earliest convenience, and let them know what equipment you'd like to see at your club! Thank you very much, and thanks for being a valued member of our PF family! We look forward to hearing from you soon!

review_text:
No longer going. Called today to cancel membership. Also have put another notice in the mail.

Had to call in a stop payment to my bank because of the cancellation policies in place that reflect life in the 18th century and not 21st.

Why can you change memberships, clubs and bank info through app but cannot cancel your membership?

You have been judged Planet Fitness.

Had taken pictures from today and yesterday, but the park is absolutely amazing. Big field, Basketball court, and a skating rink. The park is clean, but no dogs are allowed, no skateboards, rollerskates or bicycles. No alcohol, No vehicular access, and the park is closed at dusk, unless otherwise.

Busy with all the hockey activities going on in the park, softball and little league,  tot lot was busy with kids playing around.  I love the see the park being activated and people seem to be taking advantage of the nice weather.  I can't wait to see the future plan and renovation of this park.
OK people , this is a kid friendly park by far. Say less

We visited the dog park and it was fantastic. Shady had water for the dogs. Two separate areas for big and little dogs. Very clean within the gates of the dog park.

We did go to the playground but due to how hot it was the kiddo did not want to play on any of the equipment as they were so hot. Would be a great park if the equipment was in the shade or a cooler day out.

Nice Baseball  field for Kids 8yrs-18yrs old. I would say, not really a FULL size Adult Baseball field. IT also has a nice BIG SCORE board. There's also a Playground for younger children 0-7yrs. Plus there's also a Tennis Court .  Stay Safe
New park in Dorchester for kids. Will be fun for the summer

Large. Popular. Nice and easy to enjoy. There is something for everyone here. This park has a hockey rink, baseball field,  soccer field (may convert into football field), a gated tot playground, main playground, basket ball court and a few seating areas for parents while kids play. I did not notice a clearly marked path for jogging or riding bikes. However, there are paved walk ways to help folks navigate the space.  Folks could potentially use the walk ways as a "track" if they wanted to. There is a parking lot.
I love this Playground! When my daughters want to play in a park this is the place to play. With a softball field available to use why not take your family? Clean, Safe and Child Friendly!

Post covid - the toys are (finally) baaaaaaack!! Yay!
Best little playground to take the little ones, especially for ride on toys. There's even jumpers for your baby.

This place is incredible for toddlers. The fully enclosed space, the sandbox, the baby swings and seesaw, the little slides. Did I mention the sandbox? My 18 month old could easily spend all day here. Also, it's beautiful in the fall with the leaves falling all around.

I love this little playground and so does my two year old. We come here once a week. Pre-Covid this tot lot used to have a ton of toys and such to play with, but even with just the main playground structure and sand box there is plenty to do. It's also a great place to meet local parents if you're new to the JP area. Everyone is usually very friendly.
It's deceptively tricky to find a playground built with little kids in mind. This space is big, with lots of different kinds of play structures and it's all safe for smaller kids
Great park for young kids with swings, slides, and other toddler toys.
Best playground in Boston
Beautiful Playground
"A great place for leisurely walks and enjoying nature! This is a good place for a picnic. Ample parking makes the trip even more convenient. I recommend this place!"

This recreation area is super good. We came here mainly for fishing. But there's swimming area for all, there's bathroom and changing rooms, there's lots of picnic area amidst the nature. Family gatherings are highly recommended at this facility, lots of parking makes it more easy.
Peaceful beach to enjoy year-round. You can also fish in the pond and explore nearby trails. There's a playground for kids as well.
Beautiful place to cookout, picnic, or swim and play on the beach. Great place to fish too. Recently restocked Plenty of Fish including bass, trout! Love it here!
Family picnics since I was a kid, now in my 70's. Swimming. Close and convenient, clean. Good place.
Don't go on Saturday anytime.  Way to over crowded. Hard to find a good parking spot. It looked like a dog park.
Has a nice picnic area, good for swim (in summer), has restrooms and a separate playground. The trail around the pond is good flat terrain.
Moderate hike to buck hill was beautiful. Quiet well marked trails. Great views from the top of the hill. Boston skyline views. Ocean views. Windy and cold today.

Puddlestompers is a wonderful nature-based program for children ages 4-8. They offer summer camps, vacation week, and holiday camps. My son *loves* going there. I was a bit nervous the first time I sent him, but when he came home, he said, "Mommy, I want to go to Puddlestompers whenever they are open." So I promised him I'd send him for next vacation week :)   If your child likes exploring nature, I'd highly recommend this unique and stimulating program!
response_from_owner_text:
Hi Ilana,
Thank you for your review! We love having your son at our programs, and it was so much fun to teach him about nature and explore the outdoors with him! We hope to see him again during one of our upcoming programs!

review_text: The Puddlestompers program was a shining light during our pandemic year. Not only were the staff very COVID-protocol aware, but they became one of the few adults in their lives to encourage, support, and nurture my children's love of learning (Habitat Classes).  My 3 and 7 year-old always returned home from the summer camp with huge smiles, art projects, and celebrated new knowledge about the natural world.  I highly recommend this program!
response_from_owner_text: We are touched to hear how our programs have impacted your children in such a positive way. We look forward to exploring with them in the future!

review_text: Wonderful program that connected my young daughter with the outdoors. She came home dirty, happy, and bubbling with stories about her daily adventures. The staff is engaged and the operation is well-run. Would recommend to any family.
response_from_owner_text: It is wonderful to hear your daughter had so many happy experiences during her programs with us! We strive to run safe, fun, engaging programs so kids can come home bubbling with stories of their daily adventures as you so aptly put it.

review_text: My son had a wonderful summer exploring nature with puddlestompers.
response_from_owner_text:
Hi Arielle,
Thank you for your review! We had a blast exploring nature with your son this Summer!

review_text: Our 5 year old LOVES puddlestompers!!
Attentive staff, my kid loves it!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Sara, we are so glad to hear your child loved learning with PUDDLESTOMPERS!

Hi Ronald,
We've looked in our system, and can't seem to find any record of classes that you've taken with us. We're so sorry to hear that you didn't enjoy PUDDLESTOMPERS, and would love to remedy that.  If you could get back to us with the date and class type, we would be happy to see how we can help make all future experiences better.

Best,
The PUDDLESTOMPERS Team

place_name: Boating in Boston at Nahanton Park
review_text: Very peaceful and quiet boat experience. The parking can get tricky some days. Several options for different family sizes. Booking in advance recommended.

place_name: Boating in Boston at Nahanton Park
review_text: It's unfortunate that Paddle Boston isn't running this location anymore because whoever is doesn't allow two adults and two young kids (6 & 4) on one canoe. One kid running the check in wasn't even aware until the other kid lounging behind him nodded sluggishly "no" when I came up to ask for rental. This is a jalopy operation with beat up canoes stacked up. Nothing professional like the well run CRC&K (now Paddle Boston). Just lazy and nonsensical policies.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Jovan, we are sorry to hear you didn't have a good experience at our Nahanton Park Location. Our staff's first priority is safety which is why we always abide by the manufacturers listed max capacity in a boat. Feel free to send us an email and we'd be happy to give you a gift card for you to give us a second chance!

place_name: Boating in Boston at Nahanton Park
review_text: I love this place for kayaking. Very pleasant staff, check-in and checkout is easy. I kayaked in both directions and I found going towards Newton smoother than West Roxbury. However, I saw more wildlife going towards West Roxbury. Regardless, I enjoy kayaking along this part of the Charles and I highly recommended this location.

place_name: Boating in Boston at Nahanton Park
review_text: Shallow waters in many spots, relaxing day out, wildlife to observe, picnic tables to sit before and after to wind down. More popular location than a few others of Paddle Boston. During COVID, weekend reservations were starting to fill up three days before, whereas other locations are empty until the day before.

place_name: Boating in Boston at Nahanton Park
review_text: Great place for kayaking or canoeing. Peaceful and quiet lake. The staff was nice and helpful
response_from_owner_text: Ariel thanks so much for the kind words. Come on back

place_name: Boating in Boston at Nahanton Park
review_text: Lovely place to paddle. Staff are friendly and helpful, especially the man who checked me in (Tim I believe)). One short stretch is a more urban area, but other than that surrounded by nature and wildlife.

place_name: Boating in Boston at Nahanton Park
review_text: Loved being here it makes you feel like you're in the middle of wilderness but you're only 10 miles from downtown Boston!

place_name: Boating in Boston at Nahanton Park
review_text: Great place to rent kayaks. The staff is friendly and the paddle is pretty and mostly still water. You can also put your own kayak in here as well and use their dock. I've done that before when a friend is renting, but I brought my own.

place_name: Francias A. Ryan Memorial Wading Pool
review_text: The splash pad/pool has been completely redone. A lot more pool space now. It's probably 2-3x bigger.  And completely surrounded by rubber anti-slip ground padding. The only downside is they ate into all their available space so the other water elements are now all in the pool, which I feel like makes them less fun.  I liked the variety they had before that was outside of the pool.  Though to be fair, it's probably safer now without water elements on hard cement. The water is at most 2 feet deep.  They have a nice zero entry side as well as a specific accessible entrance ramp and railings into the pool. They have 4 lifeguards on duty.  There are also bathrooms and playgrounds adjacent to the pool.  Plenty of benches and shade cover for those benches.  Completely fenced in.  They have outside showers to rinse off and a water fountain for drinking.

place_name: Francias A. Ryan Memorial Wading Pool
review_text:
We love this splash pad/wading pool. It's a great alternative to the public pools and beaches. Especially for young kids. They've upgraded the entire space and doubled the pool size. There are more seating areas and now, four lifeguards at all times. They have added two brand new rinse stations and ask everyone to rinse off before entering the pool which is reassuring. I'm happy they listened to the community and improved the pool instead of removing it.

The bathrooms are the next area in need of improvement and hopefully they do that soon.

place_name: Francias A. Ryan Memorial Wading Pool
review_text: Newly renovated pool! The kids love it ! Just wish a section was made for the toddlers!

place_name: Francias A. Ryan Memorial Wading Pool
review_text: This is a great place to take toddlers they have a FREE Pool and splash area as well as two nice playgrounds with a bunch of swings . And a basketball and tennis court . I'm definitely taking my kids back here

place_name: Francias A. Ryan Memorial Wading Pool
review_text: i went here a lot as a kid and today i took my kids and they had a blast . they also have 3 playgrounds, a basketball court  and a tennis court and it's all FREE

place_name: Francias A. Ryan Memorial Wading Pool
review_text: Amazing. Renovated. Much more pool space. Every thing updated. Parking is tight, but you can park on the side streets. But this wading pool is beautiful

place_name: Francias A. Ryan Memorial Wading Pool
review_text: We only went to the splash pad but there is more... a playground, tennis courts.... It was surprisingly uncrowded. There are lifeguards. The wading pool is just that- shallow. Several sprayers, a small bucket dump, a submerged ledge for sitting in the water as you watch the little ones. There are also several benches with shade. Clean and well maintained.

place_name: Francias A. Ryan Memorial Wading Pool
review_text: This place was great!! It was a very hot day, perfect for small children. Even though, the water is shallow; Love that they have Lifeguards on duty!!!! The park is nice as well

My friend and I had done this adventure for the first time and had a blast! It was great to snow-tube and then have a meal and beers afterwards at one of the local breweries. The tour guides were great and it was nice to meet other people at the same time. I would definitely recommend this to other people!

Awesome time!  The host was great very friendly and accommodating.  Tubing was fun and at the brewery we played fuss ball with others that were there.  I definitely would do it again although it was a trip for us as we live in Connecticut.

Had a blast! Nice little tubing adventure for folks [us] who hadn't played in the snow since childhood. The Brewery was cool too. I just wish they had other options like cider for non-beer drinkers. Jamie was cool too! Definitely recommend and will look for other outings with Sourced. - Mrs. Osinubi (Roxbury, USA)

My husband and I used Sourced Adventures in Boston to take an awesome trip snow-tubing, followed by dinner and a great local craft brewery with friends. It was easy, affordable, and a great way to spend a Saturday! I highly recommend using this company for escapes from the city life whenever you want some good old fashioned fun.

I did the snow tubing trip with Sourced Adventures! It was pretty awesome and I had a blast. Everything was well organized. They picked us up on time (I had the Newbury street pickup) and kept everything lighthearted and fun. I would 100% recommend!

So much fun. Me and my girl are going again this Saturday. They weren't messing around with good times and hearty dinner. Our food was from "Rail Trail". We loved it so much, we drove up to eat there from RI.
I loved it! It is so much fun! We got so lucky with the weather. and brewery itself was amazing with games, yummy beer a lot of fun people and good food!
Awesome time with this group! From a girl from FL, the snow tubing was so much fun! & the brewery was even better.. Friendly, fun people and great beer!

They have a few good instructors but the room is too cramped.  It can hardly accommodate 20 to 25 people comfortably but they have set the limit insanely upto 33  people in that room which compromises the quality.

Great workout, and a welcoming staff. However they will renew your membership without your approval and charge your card as well. They've tried billing me for 7 months straight. I wonder when they'll get the hint.....

Been going to Power Yoga every week and love it so much! Open Doors in Dorchester is my fav studio, the instructors know my name and I couldn't say anything bad about this place! Highly recommend for hot yoga classs.

I have always liked this place - I had not been there for a few years but I went there this weekend and I was again very pleased. I am super new to yoga even though I have done maybe 15-20 sessions in my life. So from the perspective of someone that has no clue how to do things right and wants it for the relaxation part more than anything, this worked - the instructor - Courtney, was all about being with yourself and not necessarily checking if directions are followed on the dot.

My favorite yoga studio in the area! Most classes are heated 85-90 degrees and there is a parking lot in the front, which gets filled up so come early. The studio offers blocks and restraining bands for use during the class. Towels can be rented, water bottles can be bought. I've enjoyed all types of classes here, highly recommend.

This studio is truly a hot power studio. Most teachers don't focus on alignment or subtleties or give adjustments or pranayama, if that's what you're used to. There are a few exceptions to that but majority of classes are loud music and fast moving.I like it here though and leverage my previous yoga experience to inform whatever poses being taught.

I have taken 4 classes, beginner classes with Leo Bray.....he is the reason I have purchased additional classes. He explains all of the moves, how they affect you and their benefits.   His style made me feel comfortable enough to come back and I am thoroughly enjoying my journey with yoga!   Thank you Leo

I love taking classes with Amy! Her spirit and enthusiasm for life is very refreshing. I love the hear level and intensity of the physical activity- I leave feeling as light as a feather and free of all bad feelings/ toxins.
